hackathon-description-text: DandyHacks is an event about building the coolest thing you can in 36 hours and meeting awesome people. This year we decided to try something new and combine CS and Data Science together into one hackathon! We don't place any restrictions on the kind of projects you can build. They can be software projects, hardware projects, or whatever else you want to come up with. It just has to be built within the 36 hours.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Founding Director of Institute for Data Science and Professor at University of Rochester

hackathon-eligibility: You must be 18 years of age. Students from all schools are welcome!
hackathon-requirements: They can be software projects but we'd love to see hardware, or whatever else people come up with as well. It just has to be built within the 36 hours.
hackathon-rules: We also follow MLH code of conduct. Before signing up we will ask you to agree to it to be able to participate.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1010data is generously offering the winning team passes to their annual conference! In addition to these passes, they'll be giving the winning team demo accounts on their platform so they can play around with real data at scale + $200 for the team!
Prize includes $50 gift certificates to the winning team, sponsored by FactSet!
Dell Venue tablets for the winning team, sponsored by MLH! + $500 for the team!
Prizes include two Arduino circuit boards sponsored by IEEE! + $200 for the team!

Prize includes one year of access to the Wolfram Developer Platform! This includes 1000 Wolfram|Alpha API calls per month, 10,000 monthly Cloud Credits, customizable URLs, storage, and more. You will also receive one free year of Mathematica and Wolfram|Alpha Pro!
Prize includes a 1TB hard drive sponsored by MLH!
Prize includes swag bags with Sparkfun Redboards, sponsored by MLH!
Prize includes Octocat Statues, sponsored by MLH!

hackathon-description-header: University of Rochester's 3rd annual Spring Hackathon
